result.execSummary:
The defendant Miriam Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments (TRO/INJCT)], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Pay restitution in the amount of $266.99 to J.S. to be paid during probation; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered. Cash bail applied.

Provide DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge during probation; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered. Pay all mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges during probation; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered. Court waived all non mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges finding the defendant indigent.

- Absolute sobriety, no illegal drugs; random urine screens.
- Complete and Anger Management Class.
- Complete a Parenting Class.
- Complete any DV Abuse Program the probation may recommend.

*9-21-2022 Honorable Michelle A. Havas: No contact with J.S. with the exception of Our Family Wizard.

- NO CONTACT with J.S.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Miriam Smith

records.addlTxt: Request and Order to Correct Clerical Error in Judgment of Conviction, signed and filed.

Defendant Miriam Smith in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a plea and sentencing. Hearing started.  In the middle of the hearing the defense requested a new hearing date.  Case is adjourned to 9-14-22 at 2:30 pm for plea and sentencing.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Plea and sentencing date has been rescheduled to 8-11-22 at 2:30 pm.  Parties agreed upon and have been notified of the new date via email.

Defendant Miriam Smith in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
All parties appeared by video conference.
Defense is requesting a plea and sentencing hearing date. Case is adjourned to 8-12-22 at 2:00 pm for plea and sentencing in person in Room 504 of the Courthouse.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with  JS.

Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriffs
5/16/22
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Miriam Smith in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Status conference scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
